bill_title: revise the use of the children's trust fund and to make an appropriation for family visitation centers.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the use of the children's trust fund and to make an appropriation for family visitation centers. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 26-14-3 be amended to read as follows: 26-14-3. The children's trust fund may be used with any other money otherwise annually appropriated or contributed to nonprofit organizations to establish : (1) Establish or continue community-based education programs to prevent the occurrence and recurrence of child abuse and neglect ; or (2) Establish or continue family visitation centers that provide a safe, supervised environment for parents to communicate with their children or to exchange their children between the custodial and noncustodial parent . The department may not assess administrative fees or charges against the fund. Section 2. There is hereby appropriated from the children's trust fund the sum of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000), or so much thereof as may be necessary, to the Department of Social Services for grants to nonprofit organizations that provide for family visitations centers. Section 3. The secretary of the Department of Social Services shall approve vouchers and the state auditor shall draw warrants to pay expenditures authorized by this Act. Section 4. Any amounts appropriated in this Act not lawfully expended or obligated by June 30, 2003, shall revert in accordance with § 4-8-21.
